title: Pratfall Chair  Black
body: Designed to reduce the chance of waiters tripping in cafes, Phillippe Starck designed the Pratfall Chair in 1985 for the Costes Cafe in Paris. reflecting his principle and belief that honesty and integrity should be at the forefront of design. This gives the chair a touch of luxury and represents longevity and durability, while characterizing an ability to bring cutting-edge design to everyday products. This is the chair that gave Paris’ “Cafe Costes” its distinctive and era-defining look.
